unnormalised: FYI, when you address someone in a business setting, it's good to know the correct title. For instance, "CEO" stands for Chief Executive Officer, and "CFO" means Chief Financial Officer. "MD" often refers to Managing Director in Indian companies. It's also polite to use "Mr." or "Ms." before their name unless they specify otherwise, or if they have a professional title like "Dr." or "Prof." While "Shri" or "Smt." are common in Indian languages, "Mr." and "Ms." are widely understood and preferred in English business communication. Remember that "VP" means Vice President.
normalised: For Your Information, when you address someone in a business setting, it is good to know the correct title. For instance, "C-E-O" stands for Chief Executive Officer, and "C-F-O" means Chief Financial Officer. "M-D" often refers to Managing Director in Indian companies. It is also polite to use "Mister" or "Miss" before their name unless they specify otherwise, or if they have a professional title like "Doctor" or "Professor." While "Shri" or "Srimati" are common in Indian languages, "Mister" and "Miss" are widely understood and preferred in English business communication. Remember that "V-P" means Vice President.
